subject: Re: recommend a junit tool for testing Swing GUI?
msgSnippet: Thanks David for mentioning FEST! You made my day! :) Anil, you can find FEST at http://fest.easytesting.org/swing/wiki/pmwiki.php . You ll find links for
messageBody:
Thanks David for mentioning FEST! You made my day! :)

Anil, you can find FEST at http://fest.easytesting.org/swing/wiki/pmwiki.php . You'll find links for documentation, Javadocs, downloads, mailing lists, etc.

Cheers,
-Alex

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
> Anil,
>
> Many people who set out to test GUIs find it useful to start with the
> Humble Dialog Box paper (check Google).
>
> After that, to test your thin GUI layer, you can check out the FEST package.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Wed, Jul 22, 2009 at 2:36 PM, Anil<goodnewsforyou@...> wrote:
> > Which Junit tool would you recommend to test a Java Swing GUI?
> > thanks,
> > Anil
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
